page.title: 03Toby Wood Farm.
page.content: Toby Wood Farm uses the old methods of farming. With no tractors or engines to run the machinary. The power to pull farm machines is provided by shire horses. Most farms in the area use tractors for their jobs such as cutting grass for hay. The farmer at Toby Wood breeds shire horses, the normal price of a shire horse is Â£4,000 but for a top bred shire horse the price might well reach the sum of around Â£10,000. On the farm he has beef cattle and sheep as well as horses. Most of his crop of oats, wheat and barley is fed to the animals. The farm itself is about 100 acres 20 acres are covered with woodland, 40 acres are arable and the rest is grazing.
